story.title: WHO WE ARE
story.content1: The Good News is a digital media platform founded by Mariam Naoum in 2020. We are dedicated to sharing positive stories, highlighting inspiring individuals, and fostering a community centered around hope and optimism.
story.content2: Mariam is a media professional with over 7 years of experience, a graduate of TV journalism, and a certified digital journalist from the European Commission in Belgium and the Arab Youth Center in the UAE. She previously worked as a Public Communications Lead at climate conferences COP27, COP28, and COP29.
story.content3: From everyday heroes changing our lives, to creative initiatives and stories of social impact â The Good News exists to always remind you that there is still goodness and positive news waiting to be told.
story.missionContent: Our mission is to transform the media landscape by focusing on stories that celebrate human achievement, kindness, and progress. In a world often dominated by negative news, we strive to provide a balanced perspective by showcasing the good that exists all around us. We believe that positive journalism can inspire action, foster connection, and contribute to a more hopeful society.

workshops.title: Workshops
workshops.subtitle: THE GOOD ACADEMY
workshops.introduction: Born from the legacy of THE GOOD NEWS (TGN), the Arab world's leading platform for positive stories, The Good Academy (TGA) was created to inspire and empower the next generation of storytellers. With a thriving community of over 300,000 members, we believe in the transformative power of stories to spark hope, celebrate achievements, and drive meaningful change.
workshops.equipDescription: Arab youth with the most up-to-date storytelling tools and techniques to craft compelling narratives.
workshops.empowerDescription: A new generation of creators to amplify the voices and stories of the Arab world that underscores our boundless potential.
workshops.inspireDescription: Participants through a vibrant network of like-minded storytellers, mentors, and change-makers.
workshops.foundationDescription: Define your "why," identify your niche, and understand what drives your content, setting you apart from others.
workshops.skillsDescription: Master storytelling techniques, filming basics, and use essential equipment (software and hardware) to enhance content quality.
workshops.audienceDescription: Develop audience personas, engage effectively on social media, create with integrity and values, and build a sustainable, loyal community.
workshops.partnershipsDescription: Identify and choose partners aligned with your brand, mission, and values, focusing on relationships that go beyond financial gains.
workshops.pitchingDescription: Learn to craft standout business pitches and sustain audience trust through authenticity in partnerships.
workshops.monetizationDescription: Explore diverse monetization streams and strategies for consistent, effortless cash flow.

partners.title: Our Partners
partners.subtitle: COLLABORATING FOR IMPACT
partners.description: We are proud to work with organizations that share our vision for positive change and impactful storytelling. Our partners help us amplify good news and create meaningful content across various sectors.

caseStudies.title: Case Studies
caseStudies.description: Explore how our partnerships have created meaningful impact and positive change.

case1.description: TGN proudly serves as the digital arm of the Egyptian Ministry of Youth & Sports dedicated to amplifying governmental efforts related to Egyptian youth. Through innovative digital initiatives and strategic online engagement, TGN enhances the reach and impact of programs aimed at empowering and supporting the youth across Egypt.

case2.description: After successfully launching a targeted campaign featuring Egyptian Olympians, Palm Hills discovered a promising collaboration opportunity with THE GOOD NEWS a marketing mix that combines reels, quick news, and stories. The campaign's debut video generated over 700K views, with the overall metrics reaching an impressive 3M+ in total reach.

case3.description: Our partnership with Yalla Success was a perfect reflection of TGN's commitment of enabling real-world opportunities. Together, we launched a focused digital campaign aimed at aspiring female entrepreneurs across Egypt and the region. Through our storytelling approach we reached over 200,000 young people, sparking awareness and action. The campaign translated into 200+ program applications, proving that digital visibility, when built on trust and community, drives tangible results.

case4.title: Partnering with local NGOs to create sustainable community development programs
case4.description: Mountain View had a beautiful internal story, a piece of good news where they supported a young entrepreneur in their community. They could've gone mass. They could've gone overboard. But instead, they went niche, smart, and targeted, and the organic results spoke for themselves. Rather than blasting the story to every news agency, they chose the right home for positive storytelling in the region: THE GOOD NEWS.

case5.title: Partnering with local NGOs to create sustainable community development programs
case5.description: TGN's strategic collaboration with COP28 for the launch of the International Youth Climate Delegate Program significantly boosted youth engagement in Egypt. Leveraging its position as the exclusive Arab/Egyptian platform endorsed by COP28, TGN successfully drove participation, resulting in Egypt topping the list with over 1400 applications out of 11,000 globally. Notably, the endorsement from H.E. Shamma Al Mazrui, the UAE Minister of Community Development and COP28 Youth Climate Champion, added credibility and visibility to the initiative, amplifying its impact.

case6.title: Partnering with local NGOs to create sustainable community development programs
case6.description: As TGN is one of the most trusted platforms for youth in the Arab region, our retention rates for our collaboration with the Arab Youth Center were beyond impressive. Their news was the launch of the 5th edition of their program, the Young Arab Media Leaders, and of 50 selected members, 30% said they knew about the opportunity from TGN which showcases TGN's credibility and reach to younger audiences.
